tn.ref: the palace that he had built, the food on his table, the seating of his servants, the work of his servants and their clothing, also his cupbearers and their clothing

tn.text: These were servants who tasted a drink before the King does to test it for poison.

tn.ref: there was no more spirit in her
tn.text: AT: "she was not full of pride anymore"

tn.ref: now my eyes have seen it
tn.text: AT: "now I have seen it for myself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: Not half was told me about your wisdom and wealth
tn.text: AT: "You are extremely wise and rich" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
AT: "who wait for your commands in your presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: who has taken pleasure in you

tn.text: An unknown place known for its gold.
This is a type of wood.

tn.ref: Six hundred shekels of gold went into each one.
tn.text: "They were made of six hundred shekels of gold."

tn.ref: the Palace of the Forest of Lebanon
tn.text: This was likely a storage place near the palace made of many large pieces of wood from Lebanon. This could also be called an armory.
This is another name for the tusk or horn of an animal, like an elephant or rhinoceros.

tn.ref: the top of the throne was round behind
tn.text: AT: "the top of the throne was round behind where the king sat"

tn.ref: silver was not considered valuable in Solomon's days
tn.text: Silver was so common in Solomon's days that it had very little value. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])
Animals from very far away, likely Africa.

tn.ref: which God had put in his heart

tn.text: This is a small enclosure where horses are kept.

tn.ref: as much as the stones on the ground
He made cedar wood to be as abundant as the sycamore fig trees that are in the lowlands
are they not written ... Jeroboam son of Nebat?
tn.text: "they are written ... Jeroboam son of Nebat." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: The History of Nathan the Prophet ... The Prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite ... The Visions of Iddo the Seer
